subject: Re: [junit] custom results object
msgSnippet: this is an age old story... please search the archives.  One note, initializing the vector in the ctor does not give you one vector per run (which is what I
messageBody:
this is an age old story... please search the archives. One note, initializing
the vector in the ctor does not give you one vector per run (which is what I
think you are trying to do). You have a new vector for every run of the
fixture, thus if you have only one add to it per test nethod, you will have
only one entry in the vector at the end of the run.

Some things to look at in the archives would be:
- setting up objects only once per fixture
- decorating tests

-jason

--- Manjula Fernando <manjula@...> wrote:
> Hi all
>
> I need to create a custom results object (Vector) which keeps the test
> execution data .
> Can some one give me an idea.
>
> suppose I have AdderTest case for Adder class which has only two methods
> add() and sub(). I am using tmp Vector as the results vector.When I run the
> AdderTest class , I get only one value for tmp vector eventhough the assert
> exceptions are thrown in both testAdd() and testSub() methods.
>
>
> public class AdderTest extends TestCase {
>
> private Vector tmp;
>
> public AdderTest(String name) {
> super(name);
> tmp =new Vector();
> }
>
> public void testAdd() {
> try {
> assertEquals((new Adder()).add(50,30),10);
>
> }
> catch(Throwable t){
> tmp.add(t.toString());
> }
>
>
> }
>
> public void testSub() throws Throwable{ // ?
> try {
> assertEquals((new Adder()).sub(50,30),10);
> }
> catch(Throwable t){
> tmp.add(t.toString());
> }
>
> }
>
> public static void main(String[] args) {
>
> junit.textui.TestRunner.run(AdderTest.class);
>
>
> }
> }
>
> regards
> mahesh
>


=====
-----------------------------------------
Keep it simple...
(1 Corinthians 2:2, Galatians 2:20, 6:14)
